title: If you are using Visual Studio 2008, on the File menu, point to New, and then click Web Site
If you are using Visual Web Developer 2008 Express Edition, on the File menu, click New Web Site

container-title: Set the Language to Visual C#
title: In the New Web Site dialog box, click the ASP.NET Web Site template. Select File System in the Location drop-down list box, and specify the \Microsoft Press\Visual CSharp Step By Step\Chapter 27\Litware folder under your Documents folder
Click the Design button, and then add another Label control and a DropDownList control to the Web form. Set their properties to the values shown in the following table

author.literal: On the Debug menu, click Start Debugging.

container-title: Visual Studio 2008 builds the application, the ASP.NET Development Server starts, and then Windows Internet Explorer starts and displays the form
title: In the Debugging Not Enabled message box, click Modify the Web.config file to enable debugging, and then click OK. If the Script Debugging Disabled message box appears, click Yes
On the Website menu, click Add New Item

container-title: Add New Item dialog box, click the LINQ to SQL Classes template, type Product. dbml in the Name text box, select Visual C# in the Language drop-down list, and then click Add

note: Professional Edition or Enterprise Edition, on the View menu, click Server Explorer.
title: If you are using Visual Studio 2008

note: Express Edition, on the View menu, click Database Explorer.
title: If you are using Visual Web Developer 2008

container-title: expand the data connection for the Northwind database (YourComputer\sqlexpress.Northwind.dbo or Northwind.mdf), and then expand Tables
title: In Server Explorer (if you are using Visual Studio 2008) or Database Explorer (if you are using Visual Web Developer 2008 Express Edition
Click the Products table, and drag it onto the Object Relational Designer window
On the File menu, click Save All
Display the ProductsService.cs file in the Code and Text Editor window. Remove the Service class from this file
Add the ProductsService class to the file, and specify that it should implement the IProductsService interface
